verses.text: 立約的使者快臨萬軍之耶和華說：「看哪！我派我的使者，在我前面預備道路；你們所尋求的主，必忽然進入他的殿；你們所愛慕立約的使者，就要來到。」

words.note: A verb-object compound.
Often implies a divine arrival or presence.
A title for God, meaning 'Lord of heavenly armies'.
An exclamation used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Indicates the following verb is being acted upon or is the object.
Refers to God or Christ in a religious context.
A verb-object compound.

verses.text: 可是，他來的日子，誰能當得起呢？他顯現的時候，誰能站立得住呢？因為他像煉金之人的火，又像漂布之人的鹼。

words.note: Implies being able to withstand or be worthy of.
Often used for divine or supernatural appearances.
A complex verb emphasizing sustained standing or endurance.
Similar to modern 'de', but more formal or classical.
Used for washing and purification in ancient times.

verses.text: 他必坐著，像熬煉和潔淨銀子的人；他必潔淨利未人，煉淨他們像煉淨金銀一樣。這樣，他們就會憑公義獻禮物給耶和華。
那時，猶大和耶路撒冷所獻的禮物，必蒙耶和華悅納，正如古時的日子，也像往昔之年一樣。

words.note: Often indicates a passive action, 'to be granted' or 'to receive from a superior'.
A more literary term for 'the past'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「我必臨近你們施行審判；我要快快指證那些行邪術的、犯姦淫的、起假誓的、在工錢上欺壓雇工的、欺壓孤兒寡婦的、屈枉寄居的和不敬畏我的。」

words.note: Reduplication emphasizes speed.
Turns a verb or phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'those who practice...'
Used as a locative or scope indicator.
Consists of a V-O compound '寄居' (to reside temporarily) nominalized by '的'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「因為我耶和華是不改變的，所以你們雅各的子孫也不會滅沒。

words.note: Often used in 'Lord of hosts'
Classical Chinese possessive/structural particle
Hebrew name for God, transliterated
Forms an adjectival phrase into a noun or modifies

verses.text: 當納十分之一「從你們列祖的日子以來，你們就偏離了我的律例而不遵守。現在你們要轉向我，我就必轉向你們。你們還問：『我們要怎樣回轉呢？』

words.note: Lit. 'one part out of ten'
Follows a time phrase to mean 'since then'
Often used in religious context for repentance

verses.text: 人怎可搶奪 神之物呢？你們卻搶奪屬我之物，竟還問：『我們搶奪了你的甚麼呢？』就是搶奪了當納的十分之一和當獻的祭物。

words.note: Short for 怎麼/怎樣
Classical Chinese possessive/structural particle
Classical Chinese possessive/structural particle
Forms an adjectival phrase into a noun or modifies
Lit. 'one part out of ten'
Forms an adjectival phrase into a noun or modifies

verses.text: 你們要受嚴厲的咒詛，因你們全國的人都搶奪了屬我之物。」

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive/structural particle

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「你們要把當納的十分之一，全部送入倉庫，使我家中有糧；藉此試驗我，看我是不是為你們敞開天窗，把福氣倒給你們，直到充足有餘呢。」

words.note: Often used in 'Lord of hosts'
Classical Chinese possessive/structural particle
Hebrew name for God, transliterated
Introduces direct object before verb
Forms an adjectival phrase into a noun or modifies
Lit. 'one part out of ten'
Used in 是不是 yes/no question structure
Used in 是不是 yes/no question structure
Introduces direct object before verb

words.definition: have a surplus, more than enough

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「我必為你們斥責那吞吃者，不容他毀壞你們地上的果實，也不讓你們田間的葡萄在未熟以先就掉下來。」

words.note: A title for God emphasizing His power and sovereignty.
Refers to a destructive force, often interpreted as pestilence or spiritual enemy.
Characters 葡 and 萄 only appear together for 'grape'.
A formal way to say 'before it ripens'.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「萬國都要稱你們為有福，因為你們的地必成為喜樂之地。」

words.note: A title for God emphasizing His power and sovereignty.
Often used with 稱 (chēng) to mean 'to call/consider as'.
Commonly used in religious contexts for divine blessing.
Often used in a spiritual or religious context.
Literary construction, similar to 'place of X'.

verses.text: 指摘以色列狂傲自大耶和華說：「你們用無禮的話頂撞我。你們還問：『我們用甚麼話頂撞了你呢？』
你們說：『事奉 神是白費的；遵守他的吩咐，在萬軍之耶和華面前哀痛而行，有甚麼益處呢？

words.note: Specifically refers to serving a superior or God.
Traditional Chinese Bibles often add a space before '神' for reverence.
Characters 吩 and 咐 typically only appear together in this compound.
A title for God emphasizing His power and sovereignty.

verses.text: 現在我們稱驕傲的人為有福，作惡的人得建立；他們雖然試探 神，卻得以逃脫。』」

words.note: Often used with 稱 (chēng) to mean 'to call/consider as'.
Commonly used in religious contexts for divine blessing.
Often has moral or religious connotations.
Here, refers to testing or challenging God.
Traditional Chinese Bibles often add a space before '神' for reverence.
More formal than '能 (néng)' or '可以 (kěyǐ)'.

verses.text: 敬畏耶和華的必蒙憐恤那時，敬畏耶和華的人彼此談論，耶和華也留意細聽；在他面前有記錄冊，記錄那些敬畏耶和華和思念他名的人。

words.note: A key concept in Abrahamic religions, referring to reverence for God.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used for receiving favor, grace, or blessings.
Here, '...的' turns the preceding phrase into a noun phrase, 'those who fear the LORD'.
Refers to a book of remembrance, a biblical concept.
Implies a deep, reflective remembrance, not just recall.
In biblical context, 'name' often refers to character or reputation.

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：「在我施行作為的日子，他們要屬我，作特別的產業；我必憐恤他們，好像人憐恤那服事自己的兒子一樣。

words.note: A divine title emphasizing God's sovereignty over celestial armies.
Can also be a verb 'to act as'.
Refers to a treasured possession, like a family inheritance.
Functions here to introduce a relative clause: 'that [one who] serves...'
Often used in religious contexts for serving God.

verses.text: 那時，你們就要再看出義人與惡人、事奉 神的人和不事奉他的人之間有甚麼分別。」

words.note: Indicates consequence or conclusion.
Often specifically refers to serving a superior or deity.
The blank character is often used in Chinese Bibles to denote the personal name of God, distinguishing from generic gods.
Can also be a verb 'to distinguish'.
